text: the Turkish capital
1 month-ago a scene from hell unleashed
by rebel soldiers the target their own
Parliament a coup attempt that
ultimately fails today they guard a
building whose scars remain Turkey's
seat of power
gouge by rockets halls where political
debate raged now just mangled debris
those almost overthrown say it's United
the country when it comes to attacking
our democracy in such a cowardly manner
we will stand together what you say it's
a criticism from the West Western
government that enemies are being
rounded up and the turkeys EU accession
talks should even end because of this
they are more concerned about the coup
plotters those cowards than they are for
the Turkish people I'm sorry and this is
what the Turkish people say we're
disappointed this is when you realise
the enormity of what happened the heart
of turkeys democracy hit by its own
people but has the government gone too
far in its response over 23,000 have
been detained or arrested around 80,000
suspended accused of backing the coup or
the alleged mastermind the exiled cleric
Fethullah Gulen whose followers spread
through Turkey among those held in
prison students from military schools
now closed down their families say they
were on a training exercise not part of
the coup plot it will work on each in
its my brother was being trained to
serve this country he would die for it
it's impossible he's a traitor we don't
accept these allegations we're all
against the coup but the innocent ones
must be released
with the state of emergency other
spheres like the arts are being affected
the fear is political opponents are now
labeled Gulen sympathizers like this
actor who's been suspended artistic and
intellectual expression already faced
pressure now the room for debate is even
smaller more severe a multi-million
business we have probably been suspended
because we oppose the government in the
past few years but it is lovable to say
we are good honest those targeting us
are trying to turn down our voices they
think we will be scared but the
opposition can never be silenced at
nightly rallies they came together for
their president but first for their
country Turkey has united against the
coup but fear and division do still
exist hope for a new turkey rides high
but the democratic test isn't over mark
Lowe in BBC News Ankara
